info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:59PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Chouteau and northeastern Cascade Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 458 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Black Eagle, or near Great Falls, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Belt, Black Eagle, Highwood, Malmstrom Afb, Sand Coulee, Tracy, Centerville, and Armington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways, or even minor localized flooding, especially in low lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
